intro: Graffenrieda sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaved graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking shade-tolerant plants.
